required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Group-based Peer Support Versus Individual Education for Patients Undergoing CPAP Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Group-based Peer Support Versus Individual Education for Patients Undergoing CPAP Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators will compare two alternatives designed to maximize adherence to continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) therapy for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) - peer-support administered in groups, versus individual education.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a 6-week, open-label, parallel-arm, randomized controlled trial comparing peer support and individual education (the latter of which was designed to mimic usual care). Participants in the peer-support (intervention) arm will be encouraged to attend two peer-support sessions, with one session occurring immediately prior to beginning CPAP and the other occurring two weeks later. Participants in the individual education (comparator) arm will begin CPAP without attendance at any peer-support sessions.

primary_outcome.description: Objective adherence to CPAP, measured in hours per night.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adherence >=4 Hours/Night on Average
secondary_outcome.description: Objective adherence to CPAP, percentage with adherence >=4 hours/night on average
Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire. The FOSQ is a questionnaire which allows the participant to describe their sleep quality, on a scale of 5 to 20. Higher scores indicate better sleep.

Self Efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea - Perceived Risk The SEMSA contains three sub-scales, each scored on a scale of 1 to 4. A higher score indicates a higher degree of perceived risk associated with sleep apnea.

Self Efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea - Outcome Expectations. The SEMSA contains three sub-scales, each scored on a scale of 1 to 4. A higher score indicates a higher degree of outcome expectations associated with treatment of sleep apnea.

Self Efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea - Self Efficacy The SEMSA contains three sub-scales, each scored on a scale of 1 to 4. A higher score indicates a higher degree of self efficacy associated with treatment of sleep apnea.

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will receive support from a 'CPAP Peer Leader', delivered as part of a group of other participants as well as targeted one-on-one support throughout the study. All participants will receive CPAP in addition to this intervention.
Participants randomized to this arm will receive individual support and education from a trained investigator. All participants will receive CPAP in addition to this intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnea (no cut-off for severity)
- Prescribed continuous positive airway pressure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not fluent in English
- Prior CPAP use at home
- Current use of any non-CPAP treatment for obstructive sleep apnea
- A co-morbid sleep disorder
- Use of supplemental oxygen
- A clinical need for urgent CPAP therapy

group.title: Peer Support
group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will receive support from a 'Peer Leader', delivered as part of a group of other participants as well as targeted one-on-one support throughout the study. Peer Support

group.title: Individual Education
group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will receive individual support and education from a trained investigator. Individual Education

group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will receive support from a 'Peer Leader', delivered as part of a group of other participants as well as targeted one-on-one support throughout the study. Peer Support

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Underwent home sleep testing (as opposed to in-lab sleep testing)
Apnea-hypopnea index
measure.description: The Apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) is the sum of the apneas and hypopneas divided by the hours of sleep. AHI values are typically categorized as 5-15 events/hr = mild; 15-30 events/hr = moderate; and >= 30 events/h = severe

measure.title: Pressure 95th percentile
measure.description: The 95th percentile CPAP pressure is the pressure at or below which the patient spent 95% of the time that night.
measure.population: Two participants (intervention arm) missing data for 95th percentile pressure due to CPAP data-card error.

measure.title: Leak 95th percentile
measure.description: The 95th percentile leak is the leak level (liters/minute) at or below which the patient spent 95% of the time that night
measure.population: Two participants (intervention arm) missing data for 95th percentile leak due to CPAP data-card error.

measure.title: Residual apnea-hypopnea index
measure.description: The Apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) is the sum of the apneas and hypopneas divided by the hours of sleep. AHI values are typically categorized as 5-15 events/hr = mild; 15-30 events/hr = moderate; and >= 30 events/h = severe
measure.population: Two participants (intervention arm) missing data for residual AHI due to CPAP data-card error.

measure.title: Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire
measure.description: The Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire is a questionnaire which allows the participant to describe their sleep quality, on a scale of 5 to 20. Higher scores indicate better sleep.

measure.title: Self Efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea - Perceived Risk
measure.description: The Self Efficacy Measure for Seep Apnea contains three sub-scales, each scored on a scale of 1 to 4. A higher score indicates a higher degree of perceived risk associated with sleep apnea.

measure.title: Self Efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea - Outcome Expectations
measure.description: The Self Efficacy Measure for Seep Apnea contains three sub-scales, each scored on a scale of 1 to 4. A higher score indicates a higher degree of outcome expectations associated with treatment of sleep apnea.

measure.title: Self Efficacy Measure for Sleep Apnea - Self Efficacy
measure.description: The Self Efficacy Measure for Seep Apnea contains three sub-scales, each scored on a scale of 1 to 4. A higher score indicates a higher degree of self efficacy associated with treatment of sleep apnea.

outcome.description: Objective adherence to CPAP, measured in hours per night.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
